name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 2-methoxyphenol, which has a melting point of around 20 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 2-[(E)-2-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol will affect its melting point: (1) The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius; (2) The hydroxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius; (3) The vinyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius; (4) The methyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
